intro: Strobilanthes ixiocephala, commonly known as the "Cape York beauty," is a flowering plant native to northern Australia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wet tropical environments, often near waterholes or in rainforests. Its flowers are usually blue or purple and are visited by various pollinators, including bees and birds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
